summaryText: Wow, what an incredible message about stepping out in faith! Pastor Scott Williams delivered a powerful sermon on 'Walking on Water' that challenges believers to take risks and trust God in every area of life. Using the Biblical narrative of Peter walking on water, Scott breaks down how we can become 'water walkers' through a strategic approach he calls STEP: Seek God's voice, Trust God's voice, Exit the boat, and Pay close attention to Jesus. He vulnerably shares personal stories, like his childhood swimming mishap and his journey of starting a consulting company, to illustrate how stepping out in faith requires courage. The message isn't just about grand gestures, but about daily surrendering our fears and focusing on Jesus instead of our circumstances. Scott reminds us that sometimes we're not dying, we're just drowning - and God is waiting for us to trust Him and step out of our comfort zones. The sermon culminates in a powerful altar call where multiple people surrender their lives to Christ, proving that when we're willing to take risks, God shows up in miraculous ways!
mainPoints: Seek God's voice through prayer and listening
Trust God's voice even when it's uncomfortable
Exit your comfort zone and take courageous steps of faith
Keep your eyes focused on Jesus, not your circumstances

versesMentioned.text: Immediately Jesus made the disciples get into the boat and go ahead of him to the other side, while he dismissed the crowd. After he dismissed them, he went up on a mountainside by himself to pray. Later that night, he was there alone, and the boat was already a considerable distance from land, buffeted by the waves because the wind was against it. Shortly before dawn, Jesus went out to them, walking on the lake. When the disciples saw him walking on the lake, they were terrified. 'It's a ghost,' they said, and cried out in fear. But Jesus immediately said to them: 'Take courage! It is I. Don't be afraid.' 'Lord, if it's you,' Peter replied, 'tell me to come to you on the water.' 'Come,' he said. Then Peter got down out of the boat, walked on the water and came toward Jesus. But when he saw the wind, he was afraid and, beginning to sink, cried out, 'Lord, save me!' Immediately Jesus reached out his hand and caught him. 'You of little faith,' he said, 'why did you doubt?' And when they climbed into the boat, the wind died down. Then those who were in the boat worshiped him, saying, 'Truly you are the Son of God.'

Monday.scripture: Philippians 4:13: 'I can do all this through him who gives me strength.'
Monday.focus: Identifying areas where I need to step out in faith
Monday.action: Make a list of 3 things you've been afraid to try. Pray over each one and ask God for courage to take the first step.
Monday.prayer: Lord, give me the courage to step out of my comfort zone. Help me trust You more than I trust my own fears. Show me where You're calling me to take a risk. Amen.

Tuesday.scripture: Proverbs 3:5-6: 'Trust in the Lord with all your heart and lean not on your own understanding; in all your ways submit to him, and he will make your paths straight.'
Tuesday.action: Spend time in prayer listening instead of talking. Journal any impressions or thoughts God might be speaking to you.
Tuesday.prayer: Father, help me quiet my own thoughts and truly listen to Your voice. Give me wisdom to discern Your leading and the courage to follow. Amen.

Wednesday.scripture: Joshua 1:9: 'Have I not commanded you? Be strong and courageous. Do not be afraid; do not be discouraged, for the Lord your God will be with you wherever you go.'
Wednesday.action: Do one thing today that scares you, intentionally stepping out of your comfort zone with prayer and faith.
Wednesday.prayer: God, I want to be brave for You. Give me the strength to face my fears and trust that You are with me in every moment. Amen.

Thursday.scripture: 2 Corinthians 5:7: 'For we live by faith, not by sight.'
Thursday.focus: Living beyond what I can physically see
Thursday.action: Make a decision based on faith today, not on what seems logical or comfortable.
Thursday.prayer: Lord, help me see beyond my current circumstances. Increase my faith and help me trust Your perspective over my own. Amen.

Friday.scripture: Isaiah 41:13: 'For I am the Lord your God who takes hold of your right hand and says to you, Do not fear; I will help you.'
Friday.action: Write down 5 times God has been faithful to you in the past, then pray for courage for future challenges.
Friday.prayer: Heavenly Father, thank You for always being with me. Remind me of Your faithfulness when I feel afraid. Give me courage to trust You completely. Amen.

Saturday.scripture: Romans 8:31: 'What, then, shall we say in response to these things? If God is for us, who can be against us?'
Saturday.focus: Celebrating God's power in our lives
Saturday.action: Reflect on the week and journal how you've seen God's hand guiding and protecting you.
Saturday.prayer: Lord, thank You for Your constant presence and love. Help me walk in confidence, knowing You are always with me. Give me boldness to step out in faith. Amen.
